N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 139.7 - Request by incumbent state employees

State Regulations
(a) Subsequent to an appointment under this

Part, an incumbent State employee may, through his appointing officer, request
the Director of Classification and Compensation within 60 days of the date of
notification to appointing officers as required under subdivision (c) of
section
139.3
of this Part to review any
determination, or failure to make such determination, as to his eligibility for
additional compensation as a consequence of such appointment above the minimum
salary. (b) Such employee or his
appointing officer shall be afforded a reasonable opportunity to present facts
in support of or in relation to such request at a time and in such a manner as
may be specified by the Director of Classification and Compensation, who shall
examine and review any such request and may make any changes in compensation he
finds to be just and equitable subject to the approval of the Director of the

Budget. Such changes shall be effective as of the date of such appointment
under this Part. Notes
